intro: Ochrosia holei, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom during the winter months. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ochrosia holei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and seasonal blooming.
